resource.chars:
the posterior division of the inner capsule 
<s>I know of <\s> I have not been able to find any 
fibres wh: run directly from the cerebral cortex 
down to the inner capsule of the same side. 
In the posterior division there is <s>a<\s> I think a 
bundle wh: runs directly from the cortex down 
to the inner capsule. It is made up of <s>sy<\s> the 
systemic motor fibres wh: further down decussate 
in the anterior pyramids & subsequently 
connected with the motor cells of the spinal cord,
or are directly distributed to the anterior nerve 
roots. This band is comparatively small, and is 
that wh: degenerates downwards when the 
cortex of the motor area is destroyed. This, however,
forms only a small fraction of the fibres com-
posing the inner capsule. Where do the <s>other<\s>
fibres come from wh: make up the greater 
part of its bulk. They come from the cortex 
of the opposite side, they run across the corpus 
callosum and terminate not as commissural 
fibres <s>in the cortex on the <\s> between one hemisphere 
& another, but by turning downwards <s>in<\s> they <s>come to
<\s> form that arched mass of fibres to wh: I 
have just now drawn attention, ending as it 
does by <s>forming <\s> constructing the <s>inner <\s> greater part of the inner capsule, &, as we shall see,
half of the bulk of the outer.
